content:
TITLE: Adding WordPress Filter in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Adds filters to allow updating active plugins on staging and live sites after cloning and pushing operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wp-staging/wp-staging/blob/master/readme.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
add_filter('wpstg.cloning.update_active_plugins', 'your_function_here');
add_filter('wpstg_pushing_update_active_plugins', 'your_function_here');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting WP Staging Development Site Constant in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new constant WPSTAGING_DEV_SITE to wp-config.php to determine if the site is a staging/development site or a regular production site.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wp-staging/wp-staging/blob/master/readme.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
define('WPSTAGING_DEV_SITE', true);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Memory Exhaust Fix Constant in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Introduces a new constant WPSTG_MEMORY_EXHAUST_FIX that can be used to prevent memory exhausted errors during backup creation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wp-staging/wp-staging/blob/master/readme.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
define('WPSTG_MEMORY_EXHAUST_FIX', true);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining WordPress Constants in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Sets the WP_DEVELOPMENT_MODE constant to 'all' in new staging sites. This constant was introduced in WordPress 6.3 to enable development features.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wp-staging/wp-staging/blob/master/readme.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
define('WP_DEVELOPMENT_MODE', 'all');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking WordPress Version Compatibility in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Checks compatibility with WordPress version 6.4.2. This is typically used in the plugin header to indicate the highest tested WordPress version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wp-staging/wp-staging/blob/master/readme.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
* New: Support up to WordPress 6.4.2
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Binary URL Encoding
DESCRIPTION: Binary representation of repeated YouTube video URLs with watch parameters
SOURCE: https://github.com/wp-staging/wp-staging/blob/master/resources/wpstgBackupHeader.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: binary
CODE:
```
01101000 01110100 01110100 01110000 01110011 00111010 00101111 00101111 01110111 01110111 01110111 00101110 01111001 01101111 01110101 01110100 01110101 01100010 01100101 00101110 01100011 01101111 01101101 00101111 01110111 01100001 01110100 01100011 01101000 00111111 01110110 00111101 01100100 01010001 01110111 00110100 01110111 00111001 01010111 01100111 01011000 01100011 01010001
```
